Package org.bonitasoft.engine.api

Interface UserAPI

All Known Subinterfaces:
IdentityAPI, IdentityAPI
public interface UserAPI
UserAPI forms part of the OrganizationAPI and gives access to all the Administration operations available on Users: creation, deletion, certain specific getXXX() methods, generic search methods, etc... It also to retrieve user ContactData.
Author:
Feng Hui, Matthieu Chaffotte, Emmanuel Duchastenier, Celine Souchet
See Also:
  • ContactData
  • SearchResult for general knowledege on Search mechanism in Bonita.

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      User createUser(String userName, String password) throws AlreadyExistsException, CreationException
      Creates a user. The password can't be empty.
      Parameters:
      userName - The name of the user
      password - The password of the user
      Returns:
      The created user
      Throws:
      AlreadyExistsException - If the name is already taken by an existing user
      CreationException - If an exception occurs during the user creation
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • createUser

      User createUser(String userName, String password, String firstName, String lastName) throws AlreadyExistsException, CreationException
      Creates a user. The password can't be empty.
      Parameters:
      userName - The name of the user
      password - The password of the user
      firstName - The first name of the user
      lastName - The last name of the user
      Returns:
      The created user
      Throws:
      AlreadyExistsException - If the name is already taken by an existing user
      CreationException - If an exception occurs during the user creation
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • createUser

      User createUser(UserCreator creator) throws AlreadyExistsException, CreationException
      Creates a user. It takes the values of the creator in order to create the user.
      Parameters:
      creator - The user to create
      Returns:
      The created user
      Throws:
      AlreadyExistsException - If the name is already taken by an existing user
      CreationException - If an exception occurs during the user creation
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • updateUser

      User updateUser(long userId, UserUpdater updater) throws UserNotFoundException, UpdateException
      Updates the user according to the updater values.

      This method also allow to update the icon of the user. When you update it, the iconId will be set on the user and you can later get it using getIcon(long). Changing the content of the icon will create a new icon and change the iconId of the user.

      Parameters:
      userId - The identifier of the user
      updater - The user updater
      Returns:
      The updated user
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user identifier does not refer to an existing user
      UpdateException - If an exception occurs during the user update
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • deleteUser

      void deleteUser(long userId) throws DeletionException
      Deletes the user.

      Use this method with caution: some artifacts like Applications and DesignProcessDefinitions may present display problems in the Bonita BPM Portal if the referenced user was deleted. Note that you can disable a user instead of deleting it. To do so, use the method updateUser(long, UserUpdater) to set the attribute 'enabled' to false

      .
      Parameters:
      userId - The identifier of the user
      Throws:
      DeletionException - If an exception occurs during the user deletion
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0
      See Also:
      • updateUser(long, UserUpdater)
      • Application
      • DesignProcessDefinition

    • deleteUser

      void deleteUser(String userName) throws DeletionException
      Deletes the user.

      Use this method with caution: some artifacts like Applications and DesignProcessDefinitions may present display problems in the Bonita BPM Portal if the referenced user was deleted. Note that you can disable a user instead of deleting it. To do so, use the method updateUser(long, UserUpdater) to set the attribute 'enabled' to false

      .
      Parameters:
      userName - The name of the user
      Throws:
      DeletionException - If an exception occurs during the user deletion
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0
      See Also:
      • updateUser(long, UserUpdater)
      • Application
      • DesignProcessDefinition

    • deleteUsers

      void deleteUsers(List<Long> userIds) throws DeletionException
      Deletes the users.

      Use this method with caution: some artifacts like Applications and DesignProcessDefinitions may present display problems in the Bonita BPM Portal if the referenced user was deleted. Note that you can disable a user instead of deleting it. To do so, use the method updateUser(long, UserUpdater) to set the attribute 'enabled' to false

      .
      Parameters:
      userIds - The identifiers of the users
      Throws:
      DeletionException - If an exception occurs during the user deletion
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0
      See Also:
      • updateUser(long, UserUpdater)
      • Application
      • DesignProcessDefinition

    • getUser

      User getUser(long userId) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves the user. It throws a UserNotFoundException if the user identifier equals the technical user identifier (-1).
      Parameters:
      userId - The identifier of the user
      Returns:
      The searched user
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user identifier does not refer to an existing user
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the user retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getUserByUserName

      User getUserByUserName(String userName) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves the user.
      Parameters:
      userName - The name of the user
      Returns:
      The role
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user name does not refer to an existing user
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the role retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getUserWithProfessionalDetails

      UserWithContactData getUserWithProfessionalDetails(long userId) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves the professional details of the user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The identifier of the user
      Returns:
      The user and the professional details
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user identifier does not refer to an existing user, or is -1 (the technical user identifier)
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs while retrieving the user
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.1

    • getUserContactData

      ContactData getUserContactData(long userId, boolean personal) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves the contact data (personal or professional) of the user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The identifier of the user
      personal - true if the contact data is the personal one
      Returns:
      The contact data
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user name does not refer to an existing user
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the role retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getNumberOfUsers

      long getNumberOfUsers()
      Returns the total number of users.
      Returns:
      The total number of users
      Throws:
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the count retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getUsers

      List<User> getUsers(int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of users. It retrieves from the startIndex to the startIndex + maxResults.
      Parameters:
      startIndex - The start index
      maxResults - The max number of users
      criterion - The sorting criterion
      Returns:
      The paginated list of users
      Throws:
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the user retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getUsers

      Map<Long,User> getUsers(List<Long> userIds)
      Retrieves the users. The map contains the couples userId/User. If a user does not exists, no exception is thrown and no value is added in the map.
      Parameters:
      userIds - The identifiers of the users
      Returns:
      The users
      Throws:
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the user retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getUsersByUsernames

      Map<String,User> getUsersByUsernames(List<String> userNames)
      Retrieves the identifiers of the named users. The map contains the couples userName/User. If a user does not exists, no exception is thrown and no value is added in the map.
      Parameters:
      userNames - The names of the users
      Returns:
      The users ordered by the user name ascending
      Throws:
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the user retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.1

    • searchUsers

      SearchResult<User> searchUsers(SearchOptions options) throws SearchException
      Searches users according to the criteria containing in the options.
      Parameters:
      options - The search criteria
      Returns:
      The search result
      Throws:
      SearchException - If an exception occurs during the user searching
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getNumberOfUsersInRole

      long getNumberOfUsersInRole(long roleId)
      Returns the total number of users of the role.
      Parameters:
      roleId - The identifier of the role
      Returns:
      The total number of users of the role
      Throws:
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the count retrieving
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getUsersInRole

      List<User> getUsersInRole(long roleId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of users, regardless if they are active or not, in a given role. It retrieves from the startIndex to the startIndex + maxResults.
      Parameters:
      roleId - The identifier of the role
      startIndex - The start index
      maxResults - The max number of users
      criterion - The sorting criterion
      Returns:
      The paginated list of users
      Throws:
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the retrieving of users
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

      List<User> getActiveUsersInRole(long roleId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)

      Parameters:

      7.6

    • getUsersInGroup

      List<User> getUsersInGroup(long groupId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of users, both active and inactive, in a given group. It retrieves from the startIndex to the startIndex + maxResults.
      Parameters:
      groupId - The identifier of the group
      startIndex - The start index
      maxResults - The max number of users
      criterion - The sorting criterion
      Returns:
      The paginated list of users
      Throws:
      RetrieveException - If an exception occurs during the retrieving of users
      InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
      Since:
      6.0

    • getUserIdsWithCustomUserInfo

      List<Long> getUserIdsWithCustomUserInfo(String infoName, String infoValue, boolean usePartialMatch, int startIndex, int maxResults)
      Retrieves the list of user identifiers containing the chosen custom user information with the given value.
      Parameters:
      infoName - The custom user information name
      infoValue - The custom user information value
      usePartialMatch - Defines whether the custom user information value should use a partial match.
      startIndex - The start index (the first valid value is zero)
      maxResults - The max number of user identifiers to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the list of user identifiers containing the chosen custom user information with the given value.
      Since:
      6.3.2

    • getIcon

      Icon getIcon(long id) throws NotFoundException
      get the icon having specified id
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the icon
      Returns:
      the icon with its content
      Throws:
      NotFoundException
      Since:
      7.3.0
